newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Apex Equity drops Philippine stake plan.
newsitem.headline: Apex Equity drops Philippine stake plan.

text.p: The Malaysian investment firm Apex Equity Holdings Bhd has announced it will not proceed with a planned stake purchase in a Philippine property developer.
Apex said the decision was made after Malaysia's central bank turned down an application to remit funds for the purchase.

In a statement to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange at the weekend, Apex said that following the action by Bank Negara Malaysia, "the board of directors have unanimously resolved not to proceed" with the proposed purchase.
On October 16, Apex said it had agreed to take up a 7.5 percent stake in Belle Bay City Corp for $21.75 million.
Belle Bay is developing the Belle Bay City Business Park, a 19-hectare property in the central business district of the Manila Bay reclamation area.
Apex Equity is involved in investment holding, stockbroking and other related activities.
